colors.title: OBE:BS4 COLORS
colors.description: A customized Bootstrap 4 SASS build focused on integrating a full illustration color wheel palette into Bootstrap 4 elements, components and conventions.

0.head: Text
0.subhead: C O L O R S
0.descrip: These are your standard text colors.

1.head: Link
1.subhead: C O L O R S
1.descrip: These are your standard hyperlink colors.

2.subhead: C O L O R S
2.descrip: These are your standard background colors.

3.head: Background
3.subhead: T I N T S / S H A D E S
3.descrip: These are sets of tints (via adding white) and shades (via adding black) for each background color in the OBE:BS4 Color System.

4.head: Border
4.subhead: C O L O R S
4.descrip: These are your standard border colors.

5.head: Border
5.subhead: T I N T S / S H A D E S

extensions.title: OBE:BS4 EXTENSIONS
extensions.description: Extended Bootstrap 4 classes, elements and components to add more definitive and design-orientated functionalities to any Bootstrap 4 project.

0.head: Project
0.descrip: These are your standard text colors.

1.head: Font
1.subhead: W E I G H T S
1.descrip: These are your project font weight classes. Please note they are only available based on the Google Font weights you specified in your settings.

2.head: Border
2.subhead: W I D T H S
2.descrip: These are your expanded border widths.

3.head: Box
3.subhead: S H A D O W S
3.descrip: These are your element box shadow options.

4.head: Hover Box
4.subhead: S H A D O W S
4.descrip: These are your element box shadow hover effect options.

5.head: Text
5.subhead: S H A D O W S
5.descrip: These are your text shadow options.

6.head: Button
6.descrip: These are your expanded button sizes.

7.head: Text
7.descrip: These are your expanded text sizes.

8.head: Element
8.subhead: W I D T H S
8.descrip: These are your element width options and classes.

9.head: Element
9.subhead: H E I G H T S
9.descrip: These are your element height options and classes.

10.head: Ordered
10.descrip: These are your ordered list element options.

11.head: Unordered
11.descrip: These are your unordered list element options.

12.head: Material Design
12.subhead: T E X T - I N P U T S
12.descrip: These are form elements that leverage Google's Material Design guidelines using the Bootstrap 4 styled naming conventions and utilities.

13.head: Modal
13.subhead: U T I L I T I E S
13.descrip: These are a set of modal utility classes and options that will allow you to use modals more creatively and impactfully.

14.head: Opacity
14.subhead: U T I L I T I E S
14.descrip: These are opacity classes to allow for an artistic range of color blending possibilities.

15.head: Fab
15.subhead: B U T T O N S
15.descrip: These are your fab button options. Fab buttons have equal heights and widths and generally have a single character or icon in them. Fab buttons come in three basic shapes: Round Corner, Square Corner, and Circle.

16.head: Off-Canvas Nav
16.subhead: M O D A L S
16.descrip: These are a pinned modals speficically setup for use as navigaiton components for a project.

17.head: Dropdown Select
17.subhead: C O M P O N E N T S
17.descrip: These are examples of different custom dropdown select components. These use the Bootstrap 4 dropdown menu functionality, and have some added scripting that allows you to use these with rich HTML content in place of a traditional form select element.

18.head: Calendar Date Picker
18.subhead: C O M P O N E N T S
18.descrip: These are examples of different uses of the OBE:BS4 Calendar Datepicker Plugin. You can use these components to enhance the user experience whenever you need a user to specify a date in your application.

19.head: Toggle Text
19.subhead: M I N I - P L U G I N
19.descrip: A simple plugin that adds the ability to dynamically toggle text by adding a single data atrribute and value on an element.

icons.title: OBE:BS4 ICONS
icons.description: A set of default FontAwesome 5 elements and components, formatted exclusively with  FontAwesome 5 and Bootstrap 4 classes.

0.head: Icon
0.descrip: These are the FontAwesome 5 relative icons sizes. These sizes are relative to the parent element, and go up to a maximum of 10x bigger, relatively.

1.head: Icon
1.subhead: B O R D E R S
1.descrip: These are your FontAwesome 5 border options.

2.head: Icon
2.subhead: F L O A T S
2.descrip: These are your FontAwesome 5 float options.

3.head: Fixed Width
3.descrip: This is how you use fixed width FontAwesome 5 icons (mainly for lists and navigation elements.)

4.head: Icon
4.subhead: O R I E N T A T I O N
4.descrip: This is how you can control the rotation of FontAwesome 5 icons.

5.head: Shrink & Grow
5.subhead: T R A N S F O R M S
5.descrip: These examples demonstrate how shrink or increase the size of your icons (in context of the parent element) when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: You can use any number (including decimals) to change the size. Each interger represents a 1/16em unit.

6.head: Positioning
6.subhead: T R A N S F O R M S
6.descrip: These examples demonstrate how to position your icons (in context of the parent element) when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: You can use any number (including decimals) to change the size. Each interger represents a 1/16em unit.

7.head: Rotate & Flip
7.subhead: T R A N S F O R M S
7.descrip: These examples demonstrate how rotate or flip the orientation of your icons (in context of the parent element) when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: You can use any number (including negative values) to change the orientation. Each interger represents a single degree unit.

8.head: Masking
8.descrip: These examples demonstrate how to combine two icons, where one icon knocks-out the other icon when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: This allows you to show the background color underneath the resulting SVG where any fill was knocked-out.

9.head: Icon
9.subhead: L A Y E R I N G
9.descrip: These examples demonstrate how to layer mulitple icons on top of each other, and with each icon having independent colors.

10.head: Stacked
10.descrip: These are examples of stacked FontAwesome 5 icons.

11.head: Icon
11.subhead: A N I M A T I O N S
11.descrip: These are your FontAwesome 5 animation options.

12.head: Dynamic Icon Swap
12.subhead: S C R I P T
12.descrip: This script technique is necessary to do any user interaction based changes to any FontAwesome 5 icons (due to the JS/SVG rendering process upon a page load).

13.head: Bullets & Lists
13.descrip: This is how you use FontAwesome 5 utility classes to make icons act as bullets for list elements (which include the fixed width FontAwesome CSS, too!)

14.head: Animated Checkbox
14.descrip: These are examples of animated icon checkbox elements that you can use in web forms or for general user interactions.

layouts.title: OBE:BS4 LAYOUTS
layouts.description: A set of default Bootstrap 4 layouts, formatted exclusively with default Bootstrap 4 classes (and no OBE:BS4 classes or extensions).

0.head: Container Grid
0.subhead: L A Y O U T S
0.descrip: These are your Bootstrap 4 standard container grid layouts.

1.head: Container Fluid Grid
1.subhead: L A Y O U T S
1.descrip: These are your Bootstrap 4 fluid container grid layouts.

2.head: Hero
2.subhead: S E C T I O N S
2.descrip: These are some Bootstrap 4 hero section layouts.

3.head: Card Group
3.subhead: L A Y O U T S
3.descrip: These are your Bootstrap 4 card group layouts.

reference.title: OBE:BS4 REFERENCE
reference.description: Sortable and filterable tables of color space codes and Bootstrap 4 classes that are used throughout your library.

0.head: Color Codes
0.descrip: Use the input to search and the column headers to sort!

1.head: Print Display
1.subhead: C L A S S E S
1.descrip: Use these classes to ensure that specific content is displayed when a user opts to print something they are viewing in a browser.

2.head: Navbar Responsive
2.subhead: C L A S S E S
2.descrip: Use these classes to specify the breakpoint that triggers a navbar to collapse into its hidden/mobile state.

3.head: Display
3.subhead: C L A S S E S
3.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how content should be displayed depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

4.head: Flex Direction
4.subhead: C L A S S E S
4.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should flow depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

5.head: Flex Justification
5.subhead: C L A S S E S
5.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should be aligned depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

6.head: Flex Vertical Alignment
6.subhead: C L A S S E S
6.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should be vertically aligned depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

7.head: Flex Self Alignment
7.subhead: C L A S S E S
7.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should vertically align itself depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

8.head: Flex Fill
8.subhead: C L A S S E S
8.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should fill all the horizontal space that is available.

9.head: Flex Grow & Shrink
9.subhead: C L A S S E S
9.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should collapse or expand based on the surrounding flex content.

10.head: Auto Margin
10.subhead: C L A S S E S
10.descrip: Use these classes to seperate content apart from the surrounding flex content.

11.head: Flex Wrapping
11.subhead: C L A S S E S
11.descrip: Use these classes to set how flexbox content flows inside of a flex parent.

12.head: Flex Ordering
12.subhead: C L A S S E S
12.descrip: Use these classes to set the order of flexbox content depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

13.head: Flex Align Content
13.subhead: C L A S S E S
13.descrip: Use these classes to align the wrapping flexbox content depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

14.head: Accessing OBE:BS4 Colors
14.subhead: J A V A S C R I P T
14.descrip: If you need to access any OBE:BS4 color values in JavaScript, you can use these handy JSON strings to bring those values into your application. You can either choose a single color space type or bring them all! NOTE: To use RGBa values in JavaScript, be sure to copy our utility function that will allow you to change the alpha value for any color value, to whatever alpha value you need. The defalut alpha value for each RGBa color value string defaluts to a string of '0.5', so you can replace that exact string with your custom alpha value.

15.head: Float Utility
15.subhead: C L A S S E S
15.descrip: Use these classes to float content which allows for other content like text to flow around the floated element(s).

16.head: Position Utility
16.subhead: C L A S S E S
16.descrip: These are examples of different block-level positioning options in Bootstrap 4.

17.head: Screen Reader
17.subhead: C L A S S E S
17.descrip: These are a couple of screen reader specific classes for use in Bootstrap 4 sites and applications.

18.head: Margin & Padding
18.subhead: C L A S S E S
18.descrip: These are the Bootstrap 4 element margin and padding utility classes.

19.head: Text Alignment
19.subhead: C L A S S E S
19.descrip: These are Bootstrap 4 text alignment utility classes.

boilerplates.title: OBE:BS4 BOILERS
